choices.text: A personal copy of someone else's repository on your GitHub account

question: What is the typical workflow for contributing to an open source project?

choices.text: Edit files directly on the main repository
Fork → Clone → Create branch → Make changes → Push → Open PR
A remote pointing to your fork
A remote pointing to the original repository you forked from

question: After forking, your fork automatically stays in sync with the original repository.
What should you read before contributing to an open source project?
